PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_StairCommon
PropertySetDef.Definition: Properties common to the definition of all occurrences of IfcStair.

PropertyDef.Name: Reference
PropertyDef.Definition: Reference ID for this specified type in this project (e.g. type 'A-1'), Also referred to as "construction type". It should be provided as an alternative to the name of the "object type", if the software does not support object types.

PropertyDef.Name: Status
PropertyDef.Definition: Status of the element, predominately used in renovation or retrofitting projects. The status can be assigned to as "New" - element designed as new addition, "Existing" - element exists and remains, "Demolish" - element existed but is to be demolished, "Temporary" - element will exists only temporary (like a temporary support structure).

PropertyDef.Name: NumberOfRiser
PropertyDef.Definition: Total number of the risers included in the stair flight.

PropertyDef.Name: NumberOfTreads
PropertyDef.Definition: Total number of treads included in the stair flight.

PropertyDef.Name: RiserHeight
PropertyDef.Definition: Vertical distance from tread to tread. The riser height is supposed to be equal for all steps of a stair or stair flight.

PropertyDef.Name: TreadLength
PropertyDef.Definition: Horizontal distance from the front of the thread to the front of the next tread. The tread length is supposed to be equal for all steps of the stair or stair flight at the walking line.

PropertyDef.Name: NosingLength
PropertyDef.Definition: Horizontal distance from the front of the tread to the riser underneath. It is the overhang of the tread.

PropertyDef.Name: WalkingLineOffset
PropertyDef.Definition: Offset of the walking line from the inner side of the flight. Note: the walking line may have a own shape representation (in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence).

PropertyDef.Name: TreadLengthAtOffset
PropertyDef.Definition: Length of treads at a given offset. Walking line position is given by the 'WalkingLineOffset'. The resulting value should normally be identical with TreadLength, it may be given in addition, if the walking line offset for building code calculations is different from that used in design.

PropertyDef.Name: TreadLengthAtInnerSide
PropertyDef.Definition: Minimum length of treads at the inner side of the winder. Only relevant in case of winding flights, for straight flights it is identical with IfcStairFlight.TreadLength. It is a pre-calculated value, in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence.

PropertyDef.Name: WaistThickness
PropertyDef.Definition: Minimum thickness of the stair flight, measured perpendicular to the slope of the flight to the inner corner of riser and tread. It is a pre-calculated value, in case of inconsistencies, the value derived from the shape representation shall take precedence.

PropertyDef.Name: RequiredHeadroom
PropertyDef.Definition: Required headroom clearance for the passageway according to the applicable building code or additional requirements.

PropertyDef.Name: HandicapAccessible
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether this space (in case of e.g., a toilet) is designed to serve as an accessible space for handicapped people, e.g., for a public toilet (TRUE) or not (FALSE). This information is often used to declare the need for access for the disabled and for special design requirements of this space.

PropertyDef.Name: HasNonSkidSurface
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the surface finish is designed to prevent slippery (TRUE) or not (FALSE).

PropertyDef.Name: IsExternal
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether the element is designed for use in the exterior (TRUE) or not (FALSE). If (TRUE) it is an external element and faces the outside of the building.

PropertyDef.Name: FireRating
PropertyDef.Definition: Fire rating for this object. It is given according to the national fire safety code or regulation.

PropertyDef.Name: FireExit
PropertyDef.Definition: Indication whether this object is designed to serve as an exit in the case of fire (TRUE) or not (FALSE). Here whether the transport element (in case of e.g., a lift) is designed to serve as a fire exit, e.g., for fire escape purposes.
